Description: Zwanger-Pesiri Inc., a Long Island radiology company, pleaded guilty to two counts of health care fraud for illegally performing and billing for procedures that had not been ordered by treating physicians.  After accepting the guilty plea, a federal judge approved a settlement with the United States and the State of New York in which Zwanger-Pesiri agreed to forfeit $2.4 million in the criminal case and pay $8,153,727 million to resolve civil liability arising from its fraudulent practices.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Eastern District of New York

Description: submission of claims for services supervised by physicians not enrolled in Medicaid
